territory.notes: The Grand Duchy of Tuscany was transformed in the Kingdom of Etruria by the Treaty of Aranjuez in 1801. This Kingdom was a client state of Napoleonic France. Etruria was directly annexed into the French Empire in 1807. Napoleonâ€™s defeat resulted in a restoration of the Grand Duchy in 1815. The deposition of the ruling House of Hapsburg-Lorraine and a referendum resulted in Tuscany joining the United Provinces of Central Italy, a client state of the Kingdom of Sardinia intended as a transitional means of creating a unified Italian state.
